info.title: Swagger for Vivo Widgets
info.description: Vivo widgets API in the swagger-2.0 specification

get.description: Returns a person or attributes of a person - in a variety of formats

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.description: Returns an organization (or specific attributes of an organization) - in a variety of formats

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.description: Returns an organization (or specific attributes of an organization) - in a variety of formats

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.description: search for most recently modified URIs - starting from a specified date

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: format is requested by *.extension - but the only returned format is 'json' at the moment

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: where to start the list (if there are more than 1000)

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

countParam.name: count
countParam.description: how many records to show - 'all' is a valid value

formatParam.name: format
formatParam.description: In what format to return results ('js' and 'html' are valid, but redirect)

formatParamExt.name: format
formatParamExt.description: In what format to return results

uriParam.name: uri
uriParam.description: which URI to look at.  If missing will return 'key not found: uri'.  This can be simply a duid (e.g. Duke Unique Identifier - 7 digits).

preferredTitle.description: The title in the Positions section of the widgets that has the lowest 'rank' value (highest precedence value)

phoneNumber.description: Phone number from the Duke directory (LDAP)

primaryEmail.description: Email adddress from the Duke directory (LDAP)

profileURL.description: The customizable and human-readable URL for the profile.  The default profileURL is based on the Duke email alias

imageModTime.description: The latest modification date and time of the profile image

suffixName.description: The suffix in the professional name as specified in Duke's faculty appointment system (dFAc)

imageUri.description: URI for the page that links to the full profle image and thumbnail

mentorshipAvailabilities.description: A text description about a person's availability to mentor others at Duke

uri.description: The unique identifier for a person in Scholars@Duke. Faculty URIs include a value that is their hashed Duke Unique ID.  Non-faculty URIs include their Duke Net IDs.  The URI redirects to the URL of the Scholars@Duke profile.

prefixName.description: The prefix in the professional name as specified in Duke's faculty appointment system (dFac)

imageDownload.description: A link to the full-size profile image

lastName.description: The last name in the professional name as specified in Duke's faculty appointment system (dFac)

firstName.description: The first name in the professional name as specified in Duke's faculty appointment system (dFac)

imageThumbnailUri.description: The URI for a page that contains a link to the thumbnail profile image

imageThumbnailDownload.description: The link to the thumbnail of a profile image

overview.description: The text description summarizing a person’s research.

preferredCitationFormat.description: The preferred citation style in which publications are displayed on the profile.  This preference is set by the user.

imageFileName.description: The standardized file name for the profile image based off of the person's Scholars URI

uri.description: The unique identifier for a person in Scholars@Duke.  Faculty URIs include a value that is their hashed Duke Unique ID.  Non-faculty URIs include their Duke Net IDs.  The URI redirects to the URL of the Scholars@Duke profile.

updatedAt.description: The last modified date for an individual profile. The updatedAt is also returned by an endpoint (https://scholars.duke.edu/widgets/search/modified.json?since=2016-04-15) where you can query all profiles that have changed since a given date.

vivoType.description: The category of profile determined by the affiliation with Duke.  This is value distinguishes faculty profiles from non-faculty profies

label.description: The Professional Name (Last, First, Middle) designated in dFac

title.description: The Preferred title as designated in dFac.  This is the title in which the attribute of 'rank' has the lowest value.

publications.description: A list of publications metadata coming from elements.duke.edu

awards.description: A list of awards & honors metadata that are manually entered in Scholars@Duke.  Because the data is manually entered, this section may also include grants that were not submitted to Duke’s grants database, SPS

artisticWorks.description: A list of non-print scholarly outputs that represent a faculty member’s primary scholarship and are not adequately captured as a publication citation]

grants.description: A list of select awarded grants from Duke’s Sponsored Project System (SPS). If applicable, one grant uri will represent multiple renewal years, as well as any associated mini grants.  Grants with publicity restrictions are not included.

courses.description: A list of courses taught in the past 3 years

professionalActivities.description: A list of manually-entered activites falling into the categories of Service to Duke, Service to the Profession, Outreach & Engaged Scholarsip, or Presentations.

positions.description: A list of faculty appointments and center memberships captured in dFac. For non-faculty, this section includes the HR job title as well as affiliations entered through Scholars@Duke.

addresses.description: Both the physical office location (aka External Mailing Address) and the Duke PO Box address (aka Interoffice Address) as entered in Duke@Work

educations.description: Awarded degrees and professional training as entered in dFac.  This section is only available for faculty.

researchAreas.description: Areas of expertise using subject headings from MesH, Library of Congress, and a custom Duke University vocabulary.

webpages.description: Web links that were manually entered onto a person’s profile (typically includes links to a CV, department site, personal site, lab page, or Google Scholar page)

items.description: Geographic regions in which a person has expertise, has conducted teaching activities, or has conducted research.  Currently available regions are current countries and US states

newsfeeds.description: A combination of news articles automatically reported by the Office of News & Communications (Duke Today) or manually entered on a Scholars profile. into the profile

attributes.description: Additional non-array person attributes such as the overview, pretty profile URL, phone number, and profile picture

organization.description: URI for the organization, built from the organization ID in SAP

position.description: a URI that describes a person's affiliation with or appointment in an organization

positionType.description: desribes the type of affiliation or appointment

profileURL.description: the human-readable URL for a profile

imageModTime.description: the most recent modification time for the profile image

imageUri.description: URI for intermediate page that links to full image and thumbnail downloads

imageThumbnailUri.description: URI for page that links to thumbnail download

imageThumbnailDownload.description: link to thumbnail of profile image

overview.description: the overview paragraph that summarizes a person’s research

imageFileName.description: standardized name for image that includes the Scholars URI

attributes.description: The individual metadata elements that make up a citation, as well as 4 pre-formatted citation styles

label.description: A concatenation of the Award Name & the Award Sponsor

attributes.description: Awards metadata including the award type, award name, award sponsor, and the award date
Metadata about the work, including the abstract, weblink, dates, and roles / collaborators

label.description: The full title of a grant

attributes.description: Metadata about the grant, including the person's role, sponsor, Duke administrating department, and dates
Details about the course including the person's role

label.description: A concatenation of the name of the professional activity and other details found in the attributes section

attributes.description: Metadata about the activity including subcategories, role, description, and dates

label.description: The appointment or affiliation title (for faculty) or HR job title (for non-faculty)

attributes.description: Details about the position including the associated department, school, and title precedence
Individual data elements that make up the address label

label.description: A concatenation of the Awarded Degree (or training) and the year of completion

attributes.description: Education record metadata including the awarded degree, year of completion, and awarding institution

label.description: The label of a suject heading

attributes.description: URI of the person associated with the subject heading

label.description: Display label for a manually added web link

attributes.description: Details about the weblink including the related person and the underlying URL

label.description: The official name of the country or state

attributes.description: Details about the geographical focus including the related person and the category of the focus (research, teaching, or expertise)

label.description: The title of the news article

attributes.description: Details about the news article including related person, date, link to article, and news source

icmjeCitation.description: The publication citation in the ICMJE format

mlaCitation.description: The publication citation in the MLA format

isFavorite.description: A flag indicating whether a publication was marked as 'favorite' in elements.duke.edu

authorList.description: A list of all authors as 'Last Name, First Initial'

conferenceLocation.description: Location where a conference paper was presented

pmid.description: The PubMed ID only available if the citation source is from PubMed or European PubMed

apaCitation.description: The publication citation in the APA format

endPage.description: The end page for an article or book section

publicationSource.description: The source of the publication record.  Metadata will vary slightly between the various sources.  The default source is PubMed or European PubMed.

chicagoCitation.description: The publication citation in the Chicago format

subtypes.description: While the vivoType generally represents major publishing formats, the subtype relays the genre and/or content of the publication

publicationVenue.description: The journal represented as unlinked text (when the ISSN is not identified) or a URI (when the ISSN is identified)

startPage.description: The start page of an article or book section

serviceType.description: Represents the level of award.  Values can be “Department”, “International”, “National”, “Other”, “School, “State”, or “University”

awardedBy.description: The name of the awarding body or sponsor

role.description: One or many roles that a person had on the work

abstract.description: A description of the work itself.  Collaborators will share the same abstract

role_description.description: A description providing more details on a person's role

date.description: The creation date of the work as 'YYYY-MM-DDT00'

type_description.description: One or more cateogires tagging the type of work

collaborators.description: A list of all manually-entered Duke and non-Duke collaborators.

endDate.description: The project period end date for the most recent proposal in a series

roleName.description: A person’s role on the grant

awardedBy.description: The name of the grant sponsor

administeredBy.description: The name of the Duke department that received the grant

startDate.description: The project period start date for the first proposal in a series

roleName.description: Currently, this field is a duplication to the course label (concatenation of the course name and course title)

role.desccription: The person's role on an activity

hostOrganization.description: The name of the organization that hosted the activity

locationOrVenue.description: The name of the event venue or geogrpahical location for the activity

startDate.description: The start date of the activity as 'YYYY-MM-DDT00'

focusTypeLabel.description: The category of relationship between a person andna geographic region
